text.text_translated: Sam squinted against the sun at the distant dust trail kicked up by the car as it drove to the Big House. The horses kicked and flicked their tails at flies, but they did not care about their owner's first visit in ten months. Sam waited. Mr. Carter only came to this place if he had to, which was fine by Sam. If he stayed away from his boss, he would keep his job for longer. Mr. Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck. The damp patches on his shirt came together like shapes in an atlas. His skin was already turning ruddy in the June sun. Otherwise, he had the indoor tan of a man who earned money while other people worked.

best_attempt.text_translated: Sam closed his eyes a little because of the sun and saw a line of dust far away, which a car was making as it drove up to the Big House. The horses kicked and moved their tails to get rid of flies, but they did not care that their owner was visiting for the first time in ten months. Sam waited because Mr. Carter only came to this place if he had to, and this was good for Sam. He knew that if he stayed away from his boss, he would keep his job longer. Mr. Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck, and the wet parts on his shirt looked like strange shapes as his skin already started to get red in the June sun. However, his skin was not dark from the sun, which showed that he earned money while other people did the work.
